intro: Maia bifolia, commonly known as the two-leaved maia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, Maia bifolia is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
